intro: Spermacoce capillaris, commonly known as the slender bedstraw, is a herbaceous plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant has slender, branched stems that often lie prostrate on the ground, and its small, white to pale yellow flowers are arranged in clusters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a slightly hairy surface. The fruit is a small, two-valved capsule that releases tiny seeds when mature.
